page.title: 06EPPING'S RAIL LINK
page.content: The{Epping to Ongar Central Line opened in 1880,is under-used and under threat. Over 1,000 people use the line going south, but a mere 30% of that number use the Epping-Ongar line. However this section of line is important to a small number of people. It costs{Â£230,000}a year to run this line and more money and passengers are needed.Although trains leave Epping every 12 minutes,apart from the rush hour,many are almost empty. {Complaints}have been made to the L.R.T.about breakdowns.The Central line Users Group has complained that warnings about cancellations have not been advertised.Use of travel cards and increased parking facilities are helping to encourage more passengers. Epping's commuters see the threat of closure as the beginning of the end of the line_{they will fight!
